subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New here...
author: Pridegrl Neverumind
full_text:

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

hi Sandie!
   
  I am Charm.
   
  the knowledgeable folks round here advised me to use Goldwave or speechpro clear voice denoiser ( i love that one) its a free download on speechpro.com and it works- well, like a charm! ( hehe)
  good luck and welcome to the group   :)
  Charm

Isobael <isobael@...> wrote:
          Hello! My name is Sandie. I live in Renton, WA.

I've been fascinated with the paranormal since I was young. My
mother's side of the family is sensitive to the paranormal and I have
one aunt that is a medium, albeit a very reluctant one. I should also
mention that my mother's side of the family is from Taiwan and it the
culture can be very superstitious, hence my aunt's reluctance.

I think I've always had some experience with the paranormal, from
places I lived to places I've visited, but it's very rare that I see
them. Unfortunately, I didn't inherit that ability. I've only had
one experience with seeing a spirit/ghost when I was awake.

I've recently started to record EVPs, and it's been trying to say the
least. If I'm getting anything, I don't hear it on playback. 
HOWEVER, recently I visited a cemetery to show my daughter our
relatives' headstones and we wandered the place with a recorder, as
well as took pictures.

Upon playback, I notated 23 instances of possible EVPs, 5 or 6 were
clear enough to actually hear specific words. Whether or not they're
what I think they are is another question. The others I pulled from
the master are unknowns and questionables, but suspected EVPs. I just
can't make it out.

I use Audacity, which I really do not like. I had Audition, a full
version, but lost it when my computer crashed, and I loved that one. 

Anyway, I'll upload the EVPs. If anyone can help in verifying what I
think is being said, I'd appreciate it.

I will note that these are direct copies from the master, so there's
been no cleanup done to them. Mostly because I need to learn to use
Audacity's filtering and noise reduction without removing the voices.

I have them in .wav files, so I'll convert them to .mp3 and upload
them, to save on space.

=)

Sandie
